results.title: The Solar system. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Investigates the structure and composition of the solar system, describes the origin of the Sun and its planets and surveys the major planetary bodies in the solar system. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Solar system (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson, Kodak Education Program and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: Adapted from a video produced by David Widdowson of Astrovisuals, which provide over 100 spectacular high quality images from NASA, CSIRO, the European Space Agency, and the United States Naval Observatory. The CD-ROM may be used either in the classroom or for private use at home and covers subjects such as evolution of the solar system, evidence of water, ice, volcanoes and atmosphere of the planets, exploring space and cosmic impacts.

results.title: The Solar System
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: This video explores the answer to the question: What is our place in the universe. Using modern Astronomical equipment it provides a introductory examination of the Milky Way, explaining the features of the Sun, Earth and our neighbouring planets, as well as the matter that makes up the rest of the universe. Suitable for Upper Primary-Lower Secondary level students.

results.title: The Solar sea
results.creator_credit: Georgann Kane, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Planet earth”.
Our sun is a star that powers the earth. it gives life, creates weather, warms the oceans, the land and even the ice. This program looks at the history of man’s involvement with the sun, and with the latest research into such phenomena as sun spots, solar flares and the solar wind, using infra-red and x-ray satellite photography to illustrate the immense forces which ultimately control the future of the earth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Georgann Kane, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED

results.title: The Solar frontier
results.creator_credit: Peter Mellen, Frances Mellen and Mellenco Film Productions
results.brief_description: Architects Nick Nicholson, Greg Allen, and Doug Lorriman and residents discuss the cost, performance and technology of three houses in the Canadian snowbelt which are heated by solar energy.

results.title: The Solar connection
results.brief_description: The film shows how through astute application of solar-power technology, Telecom established a microwave link from Alice Springs to Tennant Creek connecting to the national trunk line network and at one stroke bringing up-to-date communications to a colorful outback region.

results.title: The Sodium family
results.brief_description: The physical and chemical properties of the alkali metals are related to their atomic structures, and their compounds are shown through laboratory demonstrations including the rarely performed reaction between sodium and chlorine; the Downs Cell, Solvay process, salt formation by neutralisation, water softening and flame tests and a number of important new uses.

results.title: The Sociological perspective: social class: work (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ken Patton, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Compares social class positions and values of two contrasting occupations - engine drivers and architects. It shows several drivers and a London architect at work and talking about their work.
